I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to share preliminary results from my ongoing research on Bangladeshi traffic sign detection using state-of-the-art deep learning methods.

**Research Overview:**

I have been training a YOLOv11 nano model for automated detection of Bangladeshi traffic signs at North South University's Department of Computer Science. After completing 10 of 50 planned training epochs (20% of the training schedule), the model has achieved exceptional performance metrics:

• **mAP@50: 99.45%** - Near-perfect detection accuracy
• **mAP@50-95: 94.23%** - Excellent performance across IoU thresholds  
• **Precision: 97.91%** - Minimal false detections
• **Recall: 99.54%** - Detects virtually all traffic signs present

**Dataset & Methodology:**

The study utilizes a dataset of **8,953 annotated images** spanning **29 distinct Bangladeshi traffic sign categories**, including culturally specific signs (mosques, specific distance markers) and standard regulatory signs. The YOLOv11 nano architecture (16 MB model) was selected for its balance between accuracy and computational efficiency, making it suitable for edge deployment in autonomous vehicle systems.

**Key Findings:**

1. **Rapid Convergence**: The model achieved 95.86% mAP@50 after only 5 epochs, demonstrating effective transfer learning from COCO pretrained weights.

2. **Strong Generalization**: Validation losses consistently track training losses throughout the learning process, indicating robust performance on unseen data without overfitting.

3. **Computational Accessibility**: Training on CPU hardware (AMD Ryzen) demonstrates feasibility for resource-constrained research environments, with ~25.5 minutes per epoch.

4. **Safety-Critical Performance**: The 99.54% recall rate is particularly significant for autonomous vehicle applications, ensuring virtually no missed detections.

**Research Significance:**

This work addresses a critical gap in traffic sign detection research, which has predominantly focused on Western road systems (GTSRB, LISA datasets). By focusing on Bangladeshi traffic signs, this research contributes to intelligent transportation system development in South Asian contexts, where road infrastructure monitoring remains limited.
